body.p: If you are planning to scale up, have a failed server, or need to remove a node, there are a few things to remember. For control plane nodes, right now you need to maintain three. Therefore you will not remove a control plane node comletely; you will just replace it. If you are swapping out the hardware for that control plane node, and the same is true for compute nodes, the process is to keep the entry you have in servers.yml and baremetalConfig.yml files but change harware-specific iinformation, such the MAC addresses, IMPI username, IPMI IP address (if changed) ad IPMI pasword.
To add compute nodes, which can total up to 99 at this point, the process is to add entries to the servers.yml and baremetalConfig.yml files.
To remove compute nodes, you will remove their entries in servers.yml after you disabe provisioning, migrate any running instances, and stop the Nova compute service
Instructions for storage node scale out, repair, and removal are found in the respective storage sections:
